intro: Farsetia robecchiana, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
